body.section: The result of computing a specification refset is a member refset, i.e., each and every concept, description or relationship computed from the specification refset. The IHTSDO Workbench can be set to display all concepts which are members of a particular member refset. There are two mechanisms for displaying members of a refset within a hierarchy view.

section.title: Viewing members of a single refset
section.p: The first mechanism uses the dedicated Refset Panel, which has an inbuilt hierarchy viewer in the bottom half of the panel, as shown in .

fig.title: Refset panel showing refset members in special hierachical view

body.p:
As can be seen in , the refset hierarchical viewer displays the refset contents in their overall context within the SNOMED hierarchy similar to the main taxonomy panel, but with the following differences.
Each branch containing a refset member is sorted to the top of the display.
At any level of display, concepts are sorted alphabetically.
Each branch containing a refset member is flagged with a pin icon.
Each refset member concept is flagged with a paperclip icon.
An alternative view is provided by the table view tab as shown in .

fig.title: Refset panel showing refset members in tabular format

section.p: Using this tabular view, it is also possible to show the corresponding marked parent refset members, by dragging the corresponding marked parent refset to the paper clip entry of the refset panel, as illustrated in .

fig.title: Refset panel showing marked parents in table view

section.title: Main taxonomy view
section.p: The second way of viewing refset members in the taxonomy view is via the primary taxonomy view (left pane) of the Workbench IDE. This supports the viewing of members of a set of refsets, as determined by the preferences panel settings.

body.section: The display of these icons is enabled by dragging the desired member refset name onto the refset sub-tab, as shown in the previous section.
